intro: Appendicula monoceras, commonly known as the single-horned appendicula, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Its leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern and are covered in fine, hairy textures. Appendicula monoceras thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude habitats.
